alert.note: Alert for Grainger; Hamblen; Jefferson; Knox; Union (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued February 24 at 11:57AM CST until February 24 at 2:15PM CST by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON FOR SOUTHERN GRAINGER, WEST CENTRAL HAMBLEN, NORTHWESTERN JEFFERSON, NORTHEASTERN KNOX AND SOUTHERN UNION COUNTIES... At 1257 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Morristown, Jefferson City, Maynardville, Rutledge, Plainview, New Market, Blaine, Luttrell, Joppa, Buffalo Springs, House Mountain State Park, Panther Creek State Park, Alpha and Paulette. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
